topics.definition: Instructions on how to get somewhere.
topics.example: He asked for directions to the nearest subway station.
The hotel's location is convenient for tourists.

topics.definition: The direction in which a compass needle normally points, toward the horizon on the left-hand side of a person facing east.
topics.example: They traveled north for their vacation.

topics.definition: The direction opposite to that of the Earth's rotation on its axis, lying perpendicular to the meridian lines.
topics.example: The beach is south of their town.

topics.definition: The direction in which the sun rises, opposite to the west.
topics.example: The park is located to the east of the city center.

topics.definition: The direction in which the sun sets, opposite to the east.
Close to someone or something in distance.
topics.example: There's a caf√© near the museum.

topics.definition: At, to, or by a great distance.
topics.example: The airport is far from their home.

topics.definition: Point or line common to lines or surfaces that intersect.
topics.example: They turned left at the intersection.

topics.definition: Prominent or well-known object in a particular place that serves as a guide.
topics.example: The Eiffel Tower is a famous landmark in Paris.

topics.text: David needed to find his friend's new apartment in the city. He followed the directions given to him: go west on Elm Street, then turn north at the third intersection. The apartment building was near a famous landmark, the city library. David found the location easily and had a great visit with his friend.

topics.example: The grocery store is right around the corner.
They traveled here and there during their vacation.
